title: Effect of Cl ions on CuCl solubility

content.question: Which of the following changes to the particle diagram will best represent the effect of adding <math alttext="1.0 milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="4 molar N a C l" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>NaCl</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to the solution?

choices.label: Some of the <math alttext="C u with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions combine to form <math alttext="Cu C l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CuCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> because the <math alttext="K sub s p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be lower than <math alttext="1.6 times 10 to the negative 7 power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Some of the <math alttext="C u with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions combine to form <math alttext="C u C l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CuCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> because the molar solubility will be lower than <math alttext="4 times 10 to the negative 4 power molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

More <math alttext="C u with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will be in solution because the molar solubility will be higher than <math alttext="4 times 10 to the negative 4 power molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

More <math alttext="C u with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions will be in solution because the <math alttext="K sub s p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi><mi>p</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> will be higher than <math alttext="1.6 times 10 to the negative 7 power" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.6</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Some of the <math alttext="C u with a positive 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C l with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cl</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> ions combine to form <math alttext="C u C l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CuCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> because the molar solubility will be lower than <math alttext="4 times 10 to the negative 4 power molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
